p: Male Wistar rats, weighing about 200–220 g, were purchased from the Central Pharmacy of Tunisia (SIPHAT, Tunisia). They were housed at 22 ± 3 °C with light/dark periods of 12 h and a minimum relative humidity of 40%. The animals had free access to commercial pellet diet (SICO, Sfax, Tunisia) and water ad libitum. The general guidelines for the use and care of living animals in scientific investigations were followed [ 19]. The handling of the animals was approved by the Tunisian Ethical Committee for the Care and Use of laboratory animals.
